links: Michael De Vlieger, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
example: Squares p_i^2 are encoded with a single bit in position i (e.g. 25=ithprime(3)*ithprime(3) => 2^3 = 8) and other terms p_i*p_j are encoded with two bits, as sum 2^(i-1)+2^(j-1)
maple: nthprime := proc(n) local i; if(isprime(n)) then for i from 1 to 1000000 do if(ithprime(i) = n) then RETURN(i); fi; od; else RETURN(0); fi; end; # nthprime(2) = 1, nthprime(3) = 2, nthprime(5) = 3, etc.bef := proc(n) local s,d; s := 0; for d in ifactors(n)[ 2 ] do s := s + d[ 2 ]*(2^(nthprime(d[ 1 ])-1)); od; RETURN(s); end; # bef = Binary Encode Factorization.encode_semiprimes := proc(upto_n) local b,i; b := [ ]; for i from 1 to upto_n do if((3 = tau(i)) or ((0 <> mobius(i)) and (4 = tau(i)))) then b := [ op(b), bef(i) ]; fi; od: RETURN(b); end;
mathematica: f[n_] := Block[{p = FactorInteger@ n}, Total[2^PrimePi@ # &@ Map[First, p - If[Length@ p == 2, 1, 0]]]]; f /@ Select[Range@ 156, PrimeOmega@ # == 2 &] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Oct 01 2015 *)
prog: (PARI) lista(nn) = {for (n=1, nn, if (bigomega(n)==2, if (issquare(n), x = 2^primepi(sqrtint(n)), f = factor(n); x = sum(k=1, #f~, 2^(primepi(f[k,1]) - 1))); print1(x, ", ");););} \\ _Michel Marcus_, Oct 02 2015
author: _Antti Karttunen_, Jul 14 1999
